description:
base: Move the rest of JSONValueSerializer unit tests from c/common to base/json.

This is the follow up patch to r189315 - https://codereview.chromium.org/12910004
where we moved the half of tests that didn't depend on json test files.

json_value_serializer_perftest.cc was not moved yet because it depends on
chrome/common/logging_chrome.h

TEST=base_unittests --gtest_filter=*JSON*
TEST=perf_tests --gtest_filter=JSONValueSerializerTests*

R=darin@chromium.org,bulach@chromium.org


Committed: https://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=191077

messages.text:
Hi Darin, could you review this to me?

Marcus, please review test_runner.py

Thanks,

https://codereview.chromium.org/12481028/diff/1/build/android/pylib/gtest/test_runner.py
File build/android/pylib/gtest/test_runner.py (right):

https://codereview.chromium.org/12481028/diff/1/build/android/pylib/gtest/test_runner.py#newcode35
build/android/pylib/gtest/test_runner.py:35: 'base/data/file_util_unittest',
I can unify base/data/file_util_unittest, base/data/file_util_unittest, base/prefs/test/data/pref_service in a follow up CL if you think it's worth. And of course if you are fine with this CL.

Avi, could you take a look at this change and may be help me understand why ios_dbg_simulator is failing?

If not, could suggest someone more familiar with ios?

Thanks,

-avi

base_unittests in ios_dbg_simulator was fixed by patch set 6!

hmm, android lgtm, but...there's already "base/data" (which contains $TEST_SUITE/ subdirectories) and prefs/test/data (that is, $TEST_SUITE/test/data..).. this would be yet-a-third way :)

any chance of converging all of them?

On Monday, March 25, 2013, wrote:

> hmm, android lgtm, but...there's already "base/data" (which contains
> $TEST_SUITE/ subdirectories) and prefs/test/data (that is,
> $TEST_SUITE/test/data..).. this would be yet-a-third way :)
>
> any chance of converging all of them?

Yep, but I'd rather not do in this change. See my earlier comment on
test_runner.py.

I think it will be easier to unify the directories after this change lands,
because the introduction of DIR_TEST_DATA will simplify the task.


-- 
Thiago

lgtm for android, sorry, I missed your comment :)

I agree, so feel free to go ahead once other OWNERS approve..

Darin, friendly ping. I need your OWNERS approval. ;)

Thanks,

Darin, do you have time to look at this? If not, could you let me know, so I can try asking another base OWNER (brett, will, mark). Not sure who are less busy though.

Thank you,

LGTM

nit: it might be nice to do a re-formatting pass here to make all of the comments line up in a column again.
